item.title: My Ubuntu 10.04 LTS Setup Guide
item.dc:creator: mohan
item.content:encoded:
In this post, we will try to explain how to setup an Ubuntu PC in your local desktop for day to day entertainment and other activities. We assume  in this article you are familiar with basics of any Linux distro.
  1. Install or download ubuntu from http://www.ubuntu.com/download
  2. In terminal do, sudo apt-get update just to make sure your software is updated with all software bug fixes.
  3. In terminal, Install sudo apt-get install nvidia-current  and reboot your computer now to get nvidia graphics configured
  4. As I do have two monitors u need following tweaks to get dual monitor setup type in your terminal type sudo nvidia-settings, it will display nvidia gui interface  as shown in figure  below, enable both the monitors and select either twin view or separate screen as per your preference and make sure you save your settings to configuration file and reboot .
  5. Following softwares from Applications=>Software Centre,  install following softwares   and reboot now,
      1. Skype
      2. Adobe Flash Player
      3. Compiz Configuration Settings
      4. Adobe Air
      5. Docky
      6. Samba Clients smb4k (For external hard drives and media drive mapping)
      7. VLC Media player
  6. Configure your external mic in Applications=>System=>Administration for your skype
  7. Copy this script and leave it in your desktop as shortcut for your skype startup need it for your  skype  (cam wont work without this setting )                                         #!/bin/sh export LD_PRELOAD=/usr/lib/libv4l/v4l1compat.so skype &
  8. Install tweetdeck from http://www.tweetdeck.com/desktop/
  9. Configure empathy and setup gmail from https://help.ubuntu.com/community/UsingGmailWithEvolution
  10. Finally your computer is social network and entertainment  ready.
Further tweaks can be found here

item.title: My other tweaks in Ubuntu 10.04 LTS
item.dc:creator: mohan
item.content:encoded:
• Mapping External Hard drives in Ubuntu
In order to map external drives we have to tweak /etc/fstab always do , sudo cp /etc/fstab  /etc/fstab.bak  before tweaking any system files .  Assuming you have proper   samba setup, by running this  nautilus smb://192.168.1.100 ( my local address) . Edit your fstab in your favorite editor and append following, //192.168.1.100/projects /media/Projects/ smbfs username=xxxxx,password=xxxx //192.168.1.100/data /media/data/  smbfs username=xxxxx,password=xxxxxx where  projects and data are directories in smbfs  and they get mapped to  /media in your local computer.  On rebooting your pc you will have all your drives mapped all the time.
  • Setting up TV streams in Ubuntu I am lucky enough to receive free tv streams from our service provider (TPG  Sydney Australia) and this guy http://avenard.com/iptv/MythTV.html  has prepared a m3u file which works seamlessly with vlc in ubuntu.  Follow the instructions there  to set up your router and download http://avenard.org/iptv/playlist-tpg-myth.m3u  and create a sh file add to your panel as vlc  path to m3u file, now you can watch tv like this :)

item.title: Authenticating GlassFishv3 with LDAP over SSL(IBM Tivoli)
item.dc:creator: mohan
item.content:encoded:
In this blog, I will try to explain at work,how we managed to use IBM Tivoli manager with Glassfish for authentication using a simple example.Ideally this should be applicable to any LDAP. (NOTICE :All this instructions here are for development purposes only,not for production systems)

  • Installing SSL Certificate in GlassFish

    In this blog,We will assume you have obtained SSL certificate from your administrator or you have obtained it from go-daddy website. We have to import this certificate to cacerts.jks not keystore.jks Import the certificate by pushing/or cding to glassfish config directory $ pushd glassfish-3.1/glassfish/domains/domain1/config/ //Make sure our certificate is ok by printcert $ keytool -printcert -file /path_to_certificate/ $ keytool -import -file /path_to_certificate/ -alias name for alias -keystore cacerts.jks By default your password should be changeit This should have installed your ssl certificate for our LDAP

  • Configuring LDAP Realm

    Open your admin console navigate to Configurations=>ServerConfig=>Security=>Realms=>Click new Realm and customize properties based on the figure below, NOTICE:Make note of your realm Name(Tivoli in our case) and your JASSContext has to beldapRealm. That should be end of your configuring part. The other default custom property values should be okay for you. In my case, I have to change group-search-filter: for my application to work. Refer glassfish manual for more information on custom LDAP properties.

  • Sample Web Application

    Open Netbeans or Eclipse or IntelliJ(or watever you like :) )and create a web application. Edit web.xml ,define your security constraints (Configuration ommitted for brevity) <security-constraint< .......... <auth-constraint>; <role-name <Admin</role-name> </auth-constraint> </security-constraint> ............. <login-config> <auth-method>BASIC</auth-method> <realm-name >Tivoli</realm-name > Notice:Your LDAP realm name(Tivoli) configured in glassfish has to match the one in web.xml. If you are using netbeans,it would have created sun-web.xml map your defined in web.xml to your LDAP Group sun-web.xml ................... <sun-web-app> .............. <security-role-mapping> <role-nam>Admin</role-name> <group-name>mohan-admin</group-name> ............. Build and deploy now,it should authenticate successfully with your LDAP.

item.title: Setting up Java/JEE Environment in Debian
item.dc:creator: mohan
item.content:encoded:
• Install Sun JDK
    • Open JDK
    • IBM JDK
    • Sun JDK
    • We got three options to install JDK We have to rule out IBM jdk just because its IBM :) also its not open source (Beside my sufferings with IBM WebSphere, IBM RAD in past,present and maybein future :) ...) . Also historically OpenJDK was buggy compared to sun-jdk . To install Sun JDK in 10.04 you have to add partner repositories if you are using 10.10 you have to enable partner repository. Run following in terminal sudo add-apt-repository “deb http://archive.canonical.com/ lucid partner” sudo apt-get update and sudo apt-get install sun-java6-jdk
  • Installl Git (my version control)
    • sudo apt-get install git-core :/$ git --version git version 1.7.0.4
  • Install Maven (Yup still with Maven and maven 2)
    • sudo apt-get install maven2
  • Download Netbeans http://netbeans.org/downloads/ Recommended Plugins 
    • maven code coverage
    • Git Support
    • GlassFish
    • SQE (Findbugs)http://java.net/projects/sqe/
  • Download Glassfish http://glassfish.java.net/public/downloadsindex.html/
    • Copy it to your local folder in /home/xxxx/Programs/glassfish . Create a script which runs asadmin start-domain and place it in your desktop
  • PostgresQL (I use postgresql for personal development and personal production applications)
    • If you are serious java developer with Oracle background and developing more than myspace website you would definitely not consider mysql :) . My initial choice for my financial trading platform was mysql and I paid the price.Moved to PostgresQL with proper partitions ,it has been smooth run from then on.. Installing PostgresQL follow the steps below, sudo add-apt-repository ppa:pitti/postgresql sudo apt-get update sudo apt-get install postgresql-9.0
We are ready for development now.

item.title: Hibernate Batch Util
item.dc:creator: mohan
item.content:encoded:
>Java -Utility class for Hibernate Batch Update.
As you may know, the way to achieve batch update in hibernate in a method is http://bit.ly/dkfPJ (Hibernate Ref),
    1. Session session = sessionFactory.openSession();
      Transaction tx = session.beginTransaction();
    2. for ( int i=0; i<100000; i++ ) {
    3. Customer customer = new Customer(.....);
    4. session.save(customer);
    5. if ( i % 20 == 0 ) { //20, same as the JDBC batch size
    6. //flush a batch of inserts and release memory:
    7. session.flush();
    8. session.clear();
    9. }
    10. }
    12. tx.commit();
    13. session.close();
     
 
If you are using spring and hibernate 3.0 ,we can reduce three lines of code as below,
    1. Session session = sessionFactory.getCurrentSession();
    3. for ( int i=0; i<100000; i++ ) {
    4. Customer customer = new Customer(.....);
    5. session.save(customer);
    6. if ( i % 20 == 0 ) { //20, same as the JDBC batch size
    7. //flush a batch of inserts and release memory:
    8. session.flush();
    9. session.clear();
    10. }
    11. }
     
 
This is okay, if you are working with systems where we do not have to batch process often such as OLAP (Online Analytical Processing system). But in the case of OLTP (Online Transaction Processing ), we often have to load quite a lot of data. This results in quite a lot of classes and we have to write at least 10 lines of code to do a batch update .Does it remind you of those JDBC days (Before Spring JDBC templates) ?? It did to me . I wrote my own util class few years ago until Spring introduced Spring JDBC templates.
If hibernate provides a feature to do a batch update on collection of objects,the code will be
  1. Session session = sessionFactory.getCurrenSession();
  2. session.executeBatchUpdate(collection<T>,batchSize);
 
Since Hibernate does not provide one,we have to write something which accepts a collection of objects and a batch size as parameter to Batch Update ,Batch Insert and Batch SAVE OR UPDATE. something like executeBatchXXXX(list,batchsize). We can achieve the above using Generics. Code below,
import java.util.List; import org.apache.log4j.Logger; import org.hibernate.CacheMode; import org.hibernate.FlushMode; import org.hibernate.Query; import org.hibernate.Session; import org.hibernate.SessionFactory; public class BatchUtil {  public SessionFactory sessionFactory; public int batchSize; private Logger logger = Logger.getLogger(BatchUtil.class); private static final int DEF_BATCH_SIZE = 5000; private static enum BatchType { BATCH_INSERT, BATCH_DELETE, BATCH_INSERT_OR_UPDATE; } public void setSessionFactory(SessionFactory sessionFactory) { this.sessionFactory = sessionFactory; } public void setBatchSize(int batchSize) { if (batchSize > DEF_BATCH_SIZE) { this.batchSize = batchSize; } else { this.batchSize = DEF_BATCH_SIZE; } } public int executeUpdate(Query query) { Session session = sessionFactory.getCurrentSession(); session.setCacheMode(CacheMode.IGNORE); session.setFlushMode(FlushMode.MANUAL); int rows = query.executeUpdate(); session.flush(); logger.info("Updated rows " + rows + " for " + query.getQueryString()); return rows; } public <T> int executeInsertBatch(List<T> list) { return executeBatch(BatchType.BATCH_INSERT, list); } public <T> int executeDeleteBatch(List<T> list) { return executeBatch(BatchType.BATCH_DELETE, list); } private <T> int executeBatch(BatchType batchType, List<T> list) { Session session = sessionFactory.getCurrentSession(); session.setCacheMode(CacheMode.IGNORE); session.setFlushMode(FlushMode.MANUAL); logger.info("Executing Batch of size :" + list.size() + " given batch size is:" + batchSize); for (int i = 0; i < list.size(); i++) { switch (batchType) { case BATCH_INSERT : session.save(list.get(i)); break; case BATCH_DELETE : session.delete(list.get(i)); break; case BATCH_INSERT_OR_UPDATE : session.saveOrUpdate(list.get(i)); default : // nothing; } if (i >0 && i % batchSize == 0) { logger.info("Flushing and clearing the cache" + " after row number :" + i); session.flush(); session.clear(); } } session.flush(); return list.size(); } }
(Eg) Ideally batchutil will be constructed in spring-hibernate config xml file and will be called
as batchUtil.executeInsertBatch(collection), batchUtil.executeDeleteBatch(collection);

item.title: Error Handling in Jersey/JAX-RS(REST)
item.dc:creator: mohan
item.content:encoded:
In this article we will try to explain handling errors in your jersey(JAX-RS) restful web application using simple example. Let us consider simple StockQuoteRestService example,the rest service will fetch stock quotes for a given stock quote.

Stock Quote Rest Service Example

REST URL

Let us consider the following Rest URL , resources/equities/price/?exchange=NASDAQ&symbol=AAPL&fromDate=20050101&endDate=20110101 Above rest url will fetch stock quote based on following query parameters,
  • symbol
  • stock exchange
  • fromDate
  • endDate
If any of the above query parameters is wrong you will get something like this, In worst case scenario, if you are being naughty and haven't handled exceptions in service layer you will end up with our infamous NullPointer Exception. Note:Always validate your query parameters and handle exceptions in your rest service layer before delegating your call to service layer. You rest application is prone to security attacks if you do not have strict validation.

Error Handling

The exception class to use for throwing your business exceptions is JAX-RS WebApplicationException.

Create your business exception class and extend this class and generate super constructor as required,

Exception class example

/** * * @author mohan */ public class SymbolNotSupportedException extends WebApplicationException { public SymbolNotSupportedException(String message) { super(Response.status(Status.NOT_FOUND). entity(message).type(MediaType.TEXT_PLAIN). build()); } ....................... .................... } Assuming you will have more specific business exceptions, we can push this constructor to AbstractGenericException class /** * * @author mohan */ public abstract class AbstractGenericRestException extends WebApplicationException { public AbstractGenericRestException(String message) { super(Response.status(Status.NOT_FOUND).entity(message).type(MediaType.TEXT_PLAIN).build()); } ....... } public class SymbolNotSupportedException extends AbstractGenericRestException { public SymbolNotSupportedException(String message) { super(message); } ...... }

Sample QuoteRestService Code Snippet

item.title: Netbeans RCP Stock Trading Plaform
item.dc:creator: mohan
item.content:encoded:
Background

As any other trader or sucker, I got attracted by Foreign Exchange/Stock market to make 'Quick Money' :). After loosing half of my initial account in FX, I learnt there is no such thing as 'Quick Money'. After that huge loss, I took trading seriously, started learning Technical Analysis and Fundamental analysis. As part of my learning, I decided to develop /programmatically make trade setups based on my understanding which lead to this rich client platform development.

Why another Trading Platform

  • Though all Brokers provide fantastic platform, it is still hard to write your own algorithm and do whatever you want on your own.
  • A platform which helps to make risk/money management according to my needs. As I know my own strengths and weakness, it is easy to customize and build rules for my needs
  • Main reason in this helps me to improve my Programming skills as well as Trading skills (It took me a while to understand,mental skills and keeping thing simple is important :) )

Why Netbeans RCP

As I am a Java developer,I started developing my application with Java Swing based on JFreeChart (http://www.jfree.org/jfreechart/). After spending one month, I dropped this project realizing developing an interactive charting 'Good Looking (:P)' application is going to take years with JFree Chart and Java Swing. After a while, I stumbled across Netbeans based open source HumaiTrader (http://sourceforge.net/projects/humaitrader/). It is possibly the best free Trading platform available still now,but unfortunately this project is tightly coupled to its framework and also the project is dead. This lead to own trading platform by just using(ripping) HumaiTrader charting package. I decided to stick with netbeans rcp because,

  • Very Rich Application desktop framework(Rich Window ,Rich explorer,Toolbar,Quick Search, Progress Bar...)
  • Pure Java Swing Based Framework(not like Eclipse SWT )
  • Very active community

item.title: Finding jar for a class in IBM Websphere
item.dc:creator: mohan
item.content:encoded:
Find Jar in Websphere

If you want to find a class file,Most of the time googling it or going to Maven Repo or Findjar will tell you where the jar is. But our friendly IBM Websphere will get you to its API :) not jar .Today, I ran into Websphere specific error, java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/ibm/ws/bootstrap/RASWsLoggerFactory I have to do something like this below to find the class 'RASWsLoggerFactory' from websphere folder, mambalav/cygdrive/c/IBM/Websphere/runtimes/base_v7/ $ find . -name '*.jar' -type f|xargs -i bash -c "jar tvf {}|grep 'RASWsLoggerFactory' && echo {}" If you are a unix geek,you can tweak the above command and make it as a script and search any class from anywhere. But Trust me googling is faster in most of the cases :). After a while, found out RASWsLoggerFactory is in IBM JDK ext folder and I was pointing to Sun JDK in my Netbeans IDE :).
